video.title: Calculating Real Return in Last Year Dollars
video.description: Calculating real return in last year dollars.

problemSets.question: You’ve invested _x in _a, _A and your return on the investment is _y in _b, _B. Assuming there was an inflation rate of _z, what is the value of _y in _a, _A money?
hint: \( Value \: of \: later \: date \: on \: the \: earlier \: date \: = \: {(Value \: of \: later \: date) \over (1 \: + \: Inflation \: rate)} \)

problemSets.question: You’ve invested _x in _a, _A and your return on the investment is _y in _b, _B. Assuming there was an inflation rate of _z, what is the Real return on your investment on _b, _B?
hint: \( Value \: of \: later \: date \: on \: the \: earlier \: date \: = \: {(Value \: of \: later \: date) \over (1 \: + \: Inflation \: rate)} \)
\( Real \: Rate \: of \: Return \: = \: {(1 \: + \: Nominal \: Rate) \over (1 \: + \: Inflation \: Rate)} - 1 \)

problemSets.question: What is the difference between calculating last years money in today’s money, and today’s money in last years money?

choices.answer: To solve for last years money in today’s money, you multiply last years money by (1 + inflation rate). Today’s money in last years money valuation is calculated by dividing today’s money by (1 + Inflation Rate).

problemSets.question: What is the difference between a Nominal Rate of Return and Real Rate of Return?

choices.answer: The Real Rate of Return ignores the effects from changes to purchasing power (i.e. inflation), while Nominal Rate of Return includes those effects in its the calculation.
